titleStmt.title: Murder will out, or, The King's letter justifying the Marquess of Antrim and declaring that what he did in the Irish rebellion was by direction from his royal father and mother, and for the service of the crown.
titleStmt.author: Arlington, Henry Bennet, Earl of, 1618-1685.
Charles II, King of England, 1630-1685.
Gregory XV, Pope, 1554-1623.

notesStmt.note: Collection of letters and declarations chiefly by Charles, and a letter from Pope Gregory XV. Includes Charles's letter exonerating MacDonnell which is signed: By His Majesty's command, Henry Bennet.
This item appears at reel 179:14 and at reel 1708:1.
Reproduction of originals in Huntington Library and University of Illinois (Urbana-Champaign Campus). Library.
